title: US defence 'made in China': Is Washington ready for war with Beijing?
content: A report reveals the US defense sector's reliance on China. Chinese firms supply critical components for US defense programs. These programs include missile defense and nuclear systems. The US military supply chains are deeply connected with Beijing's industries. The report highlights US vulnerability due to China's dominance in critical minerals. Experts suggest dissecting critical components instead of complete decoupling.

title: PM Modi in Ghana receives warm welcome from President Mahama at airport
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarked on a five-nation tour, commencing in Ghana where he was greeted by President John Mahama. His itinerary includes visits to Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, and Brazil for the BRICS Summit. Modi aims to bolster ties in investment, energy, and trade, marking significant bilateral visits and focusing on collaboration with Global South partners.

title: Two Tests, two tons! Captain Shubman Gill delivers in style
content: Shubman Gill’s celebration reflected the emotion of the moment. After reaching the three-figure mark, he let out a roar, raised his helmet high in the air, took a bow towards the crowd, and kissed his bat — a sequence that captured the pride, relief, and joy of the achievement.

title: Mid-air panic: SpiceJet flight's cabin window frame comes loose
content: A SpiceJet flight from Pune to Goa experienced a mid-air incident when a window frame became dislodged, causing passenger concern. The airline clarified that the dislodged component was a non-structural trim piece and did not affect the aircraft's safety or cabin pressure. The frame was reattached after landing, and SpiceJet reaffirmed its commitment to safety standards.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role in this
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: 9 sixes! Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history with another explosive knock
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi achieved a milestone. He scored the second-fastest fifty for India in Under-19 ODIs. He reached the landmark in just 20 balls against England. Rishabh Pant holds the record with an 18-ball fifty. Suryavanshi smashed 86 runs with six fours and nine sixes. He has consistently performed well in the series.

title: 'Gave him anxiety pills': Mumbai teacher held for sexually assaulting boy for a year
content: In Mumbai, a school teacher and her friend were arrested by Dadar police. They are accused of sexually assaulting a teenage student for a year. The teacher allegedly groomed the boy, offered him alcohol and medication. The survivor confided in a friend, who alerted the school. Police are investigating the teacher's past interactions with students.

title: Chess | 'Gukesh hasn't done anything to do well': Carlsen fires fresh shots
content: Magnus Carlsen and Gukesh Dommaraju's rivalry intensifies at the SuperUnited Rapid & Blitz in Zagreb, fueled by Carlsen's dismissive remarks about Gukesh's rapid and blitz capabilities. Carlsen, returning to Zagreb after missing last year due to his mother's passing, aims to dominate in his preferred formats against a world-class field including Gukesh, Praggnanandhaa, and Caruana.

title: Trump's warning to Elon Musk on 'Big Beautiful Bill': 'May have to close up shop ...'
content: Donald Trump has warned Elon Musk about relying on government subsidies, suggesting Musk might have to return to South Africa without them. This feud ignited over the "Big Beautiful Bill," with Trump criticizing Musk's dependence on federal funds for Tesla and SpaceX. Musk responded by slamming the bill as fiscally irresponsible and threatening to form a new political party.

title: Uttarakhand floods: Alaknanda River overflows, 15-foot Shiva statue submerges
content: Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh are reeling under monsoon fury, triggering floods and landslides. Rudraprayag faces a flood-like situation as the Alaknanda River surges, submerging areas. A cloudburst in Mandi district, Himachal Pradesh, has resulted in casualties and missing persons, prompting rescue operations. The IMD has issued a red alert for Himachal Pradesh, forecasting heavy rainfall and potential flash floods.

title: ‘On the first boat out’: Viral petition seeks Melania Trump’s deportation
content: A petition demanding the deportation of Melania Trump, her son Barron, and her parents has gained traction amidst criticism of Donald Trump's plan targeting naturalised citizens. The petition argues for consistent application of deportation policies, referencing Melania's naturalised status and Barron's birth. This follows Congresswoman Maxine Waters questioning Melania's immigration history and the citizenship status of her parents.

title: Kolkata rape case: 'Mango' took off his shirt to show 'no scratch marks'
content: Amidst the uproar following the Kolkata law college rape case, Manojit Mishra's lawyer, Raju Ganguly, claimed the absence of scratch marks on his client's body, except for a 'love bite.' Ganguly suggested examining the victim's phone records, hinting that the case might not be a rape. Kolkata police have transferred the investigation to the detective department.

title: ChatGPT warning: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman asks users not to trust AI ‘much’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: Operation Chhatru: Encounter between security forces and terrorists in J&K
content: A joint operation by the J&K police, Army, and CRPF in Kishtwar's Kuchal area led to an encounter with terrorists on Wednesday. The gunfight erupted after terrorists fired upon the security forces during a search operation in Kanzal Mandu. Reinforcements have been deployed to cordon off the area and neutralize the threat.

title: Backfires! Rishabh Pant falls into Ben Stokes' trap – WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting approach led to his dismissal on Day 1 of the Edgbaston Test, impacting India's momentum. Despite his recent strong form, including a standout performance in the previous match and a high ICC ranking, Pant's misjudged shot selection proved costly.

title: No H-1B visa? No problem: Here are the top alternate US work visa options - explained
content: Facing H-1B lottery setbacks? US companies have alternative visa options to retain global talent. Strategies include cap-exempt H-1Bs, L-1 intracompany transfers, O-1 visas for extraordinary ability, and country-specific visas. Further education, J-1 programs, and green card sponsorship offer additional pathways for international employees to contribute to US firms.

title: Brunson reacts with humor — Knicks star gives unexpected take amid ongoing NY coaching shake-up
content: Following Tom Thibodeau's dismissal, the New York Knicks' coaching search took an interesting turn as Jalen Brunson reacted cryptically to reports that his father, Rick Brunson, would remain on staff. While Mike Brown emerged as a frontrunner, Jalen's sarcastic social media post added intrigue to the ongoing process, highlighting the complexities of the Knicks' decision-making under James Dolan.

title: Drew McIntyre wows in Indian attire — stuns fans at Jinder Mahal wedding
content: Former WWE star Jinder Mahal, now known as Raj Dhesi, celebrated his marriage to Priya in June 2025, surrounded by fellow wrestling stars. Drew McIntyre and his wife, Kaitlyn Frohnapfel, attended the ceremony in traditional Indian attire. The wedding also marked a 3MB reunion, with McIntyre and Heath Slater joining Mahal for the celebrations, evoking nostalgia among WWE fans.

title: IND vs ENG: ‘Kuldeep should bat at No. 3' - Bold advice from cricket expert
content: Kuldeep Yadav's exclusion from the second Test against England has sparked criticism, with Dodda Ganesh sarcastically suggesting he focus on Ranji Trophy batting to regain favor. This omission highlights concerns about India's over-reliance on all-rounders, sidelining specialist bowlers like Kuldeep, who has consistently performed well when given opportunities.

title: Explained: Why ‘Diddy’ was acquitted of sex trafficking charges
content: Sean “Diddy” Combs was found guilty on two federal counts of transporting women for prostitution, but acquitted of sex-trafficking and racketeering conspiracy charges. The verdict, delivered in New York, stunned the entertainment industry. Combs faces up to 20 years in prison.

title: President's rule in Bihar? Tejashwi alleges 'major controversy unfolding'
content: Tejashwi Yadav alleges a BJP conspiracy to impose President's Rule in Bihar post-election, claiming Amit Shah's support for Nitish Kumar is temporary. He accuses the Election Commission of disenfranchising the poor through electoral roll revisions, alleging bias towards the BJP and RSS. The upcoming assembly election pits the NDA against the Mahagathbandhan in a high-stakes battle.

title: IND vs ENG: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma spotted in London
content: Virat Kohli, recently retired from Test cricket, was seen in London with his wife Anushka Sharma as India and England continue their Test series. India, led by Shubman Gill, trails 0-1, making changes for the second Test at Edgbaston where England chose to bowl first. England wears black armbands to honor Wayne Larkins.

title: UP man tries to jump off flyover after wife refuses to return home; saved by cop
content: In Agra, a 22-year-old man from Farrukhabad was rescued by police on July 1st after attempting suicide from a flyover. The incident occurred following a dispute with his wife, who refused to return home with him. Dramatic footage shows the man on the edge of the Shamshabad flyover as onlookers gathered. A quick-thinking policeman intervened, preventing the suicide.

title: Can Dalai Lama successor be a woman?
content: The Dalai Lama has asserted that the Tibetan Buddhist institution will endure beyond his lifetime, emphasizing that China should not interfere in choosing his successor. He stated the next Dalai Lama should be identified following historical Buddhist customs. The spiritual leader also suggested his successor could be female, clarifying previous controversial remarks and reaffirming gender equality within Buddhism.

title: One Big Beautiful Break-Up: Will Musk escalate after Trump's deportation threat?
content: This saga has everything: betrayal, power plays, reality TV drama, Game of Thrones energy, and memes so surreal they feel like AI fever dreams. Musk, ever the chaos agent, tweeted: “So tempting to escalate this. So, so tempting. But I will refrain for now.”

title: Tesla EV sales plunge! 13% drop in three months; anti-Elon Musk sentiment harms
content: Tesla's sales have declined by 13% in the last three months, impacted by Elon Musk's political views and support for Donald Trump, raising concerns about the upcoming second-quarter earnings report. Despite the overall dip, sales of Models 3 and Y exceeded Wall Street expectations, providing a boost to Tesla shares.

title: Indian charged in Singapore: Seafarer held for ship collision - 'acted without orders'
content: Soosai Antony Vainer, an Indian national, faces charges in Singapore for a fatal ship collision last year. As the duty lookout on the Hafnia Nile, Vainer allegedly failed to report the approaching Ceres I to his superior, Wickramage Viraj Amila Shavinda Perera. Instead, he steered the ship independently, leading to the collision that killed one and injured another.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Shefali Jariwala's death mystery, emotional note from Sunjay Kapur's sister; and more
content: The entertainment world is abuzz with headlines that blend drama, emotion, and intrigue. From the ongoing forensic investigation into Shefali Jariwala’s tragic demise, where chemical analysis is still underway, to Mandhira Kapur’s heartfelt message remembering her brother Sunjay Kapur and their late father—emotions are running high. Meanwhile, Abhishek Bachchan breaks his silence on social media trolling, saying, “I have a family, it's upsetting,” as he addresses the wave of misinformation surrounding him. Here are the top 5 entertainment stories making the loudest noise in tinsel town today.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You cannot pick and choose' - Ex-India pacer to Bumrah
content: Irfan Pathan has criticized Jasprit Bumrah's absence from the second Test against England, questioning the workload management approach when the team needs him most. Pathan urges selectors to prepare for a future without Bumrah and Shami in Test cricket, emphasizing the need for stability and continuity for younger bowlers.

title: China out, India-based Gaden Phodrang Trust will pick Dalai Lama successor
content: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: BJP announces new leaders for seven states; inches closer to elect new national president
content: Bharatiya Janata Party appointed nine new presidents across seven states and two union territories, including key states like Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Telangana. The party is expected to announce state chiefs for West Bengal and Odisha soon. This move is part of BJP's second phase of its organizational drive, following internal elections completed in 28 states and union territories.

title: Big, Beautiful Bill: Trump calls it path to US making a ‘fortune’
content: US President Donald Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill' narrowly passed the Senate, facing concerns over welfare cuts and a $3 trillion debt increase. Trump claims the bill will bring unprecedented growth and investment, fueled by tariffs. The legislation extends tax cuts, reduces Medicaid and food assistance, and boosts border control spending.

title: Yashavi Jaiswal vs Ben Stokes war of words lights up Edgbaston – WATCH
content: During the second Test match at Edgbaston, Ben Stokes and Yashasvi Jaiswal had a heated exchange. This happened when Jaiswal took a quick single. Jaiswal responded sharply to Stokes' words. Jaiswal, who scored a century in the previous Test, reached his half-century. England chose to bowl after winning the toss. They kept the same team.

title: Sovereign Gold Bonds earn over 200% returns: RBI announces redemption price
content: The Reserve Bank of India has set the redemption price at Rs 9,628 per unit for two Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) tranches, specifically the 2017-18 Series-XIV and 2018-19 Series-IV, maturing for premature redemption on July 1st.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Infosys employee caught filming woman in washroom; arrested
content: In Bengaluru, an Infosys employee, Swapnil Nagesh Mali, has been detained for allegedly recording a female colleague in a company washroom. The victim, a Technical Test Lead, reported the incident at the Electronics City office on June 30th. Colleagues discovered incriminating videos on Mali's phone, including one of the complainant.

title: 'Shami forced me to quit': Hasin Jahan calls pacer a criminal
content: Hasin Jahan, estranged wife of cricketer Mohammed Shami, alleges financial neglect and accuses him of ruining her life after she gave up her career post-marriage. The Calcutta High Court has directed Shami to pay Rs 4 lakh monthly as interim maintenance, Rs 1.5 lakh for Jahan and Rs 2.5 lakh for their daughter, deeming it 'just, fair and reasonable'.

title: 'Destination you'll never want to leave': UK F-35B’s extended vacation in Kerala
content: Kerala Tourism cleverly capitalized on the unexpected grounding of a British Royal Navy's advanced F-35B fighter jet at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport due to a hydraulic failure. They launched a witty marketing campaign, featuring the stranded jet with a humorous tagline and a five-star review, highlighting Kerala as an unforgettable destination.

title: 'Kuldeep is India's next attacking option after Bumrah': Ex-Aus captain slams India
content: Former Australian captain Aaron Finch has criticized India's team selection for the second Test against England, questioning the exclusion of Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav. Finch expressed surprise at benching Bumrah, considering him the world's best bowler. Shubman Gill cited workload management for Bumrah's absence and the desire for batting depth as reasons for not including Kuldeep.

title: Gujarat shocker: 14-year-old boy rapes, impregnates 16-year-old sister in Surat
content: In Surat, a shocking case has emerged involving a 16-year-old girl found pregnant, with her 14-year-old brother implicated. The pregnancy was discovered after she complained of abdominal pain. Police have filed an FIR, invoking the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and POCSO Act. The boy will be presented before the Juvenile Justice Board.

title: Watch: John Cena makes surprise Wimbledon appearance; video goes viral
content: Wimbledon 2025 witnessed upsets on the court as several seeded players lost in the opening round. John Cena's presence in the stands created a buzz after the celebrity was seen with Shay Shariatzadeh. Other celebrities like Stuart Broad, David Beckham, and Maria Sharapova were also in attendance on the first day.

title: India no. 1 Praggnanandhaa makes honest admission: 'It's difficult to play classical'
content: Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa suggests top chess players like Carlsen and Nakamura are shifting away from classical chess due to its demanding preparation and mental fatigue. He highlights the extensive opening preparation required in classical games, contrasting it with the freedom of freestyle chess. Praggnanandhaa acknowledges his preference for faster formats but emphasizes classical chess remains fundamental.

title: New strategic oil reserves! India to boost emergency stockpile
content: India is planning to build three more strategic oil storage facilities to boost its energy security. These new reserves, including facilities in Bikaner, Mangalore, and Bina, will add to the existing capacity of 5.33 million tonnes.

title: '16-year-old me': When Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared monochrome memory from her teen
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently shared a nostalgic throwback photo on Instagram, offering fans a glimpse into her teenage years at 16. The monochrome picture captures a quiet moment of introspection, with Samantha seated on a couch, dressed in a printed short dress and white shrug. More recently, Samantha shared highlights from her June, including a heartwarming lunch date with Keerthy Suresh.

title: IND vs ENG: 'It should be taken out of the players hand' - Shastri on Bumrah
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri expressed surprise at Jasprit Bumrah's exclusion from the crucial second Test against England. Shastri emphasized that captain and coach should decide the playing XI. He questioned Sai Sudharsan's dropping and felt for Kuldeep Yadav's continued wait. England chose to field first after winning the toss at Edgbaston.

title: Cheng Hao’s AI robot football stuns; historic Beijing match marks new era
content: In Beijing, China, history was made on June 29, 2025, with the first AI humanoid robot football tournament. Despite humorous moments like frequent falls and missed kicks, the event, organized by Booster Robotics, showcased the potential of AI in sports. Tsinghua University's THU Robotics team emerged victorious, marking a significant step in the evolution of AI-driven athletic competition.

title: Vanessa Bryant shares rare throwback— features Kobe and sister Sophie — birthday homage
content: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a nostalgic throwback picture featuring her late husband, Kobe Bryant, on her sister Sophie's birthday, reminding Lakers fans of cherished NBA memories. She also addressed and dismissed rumors of her pregnancy, emphasizing her focus on family and personal well-being.

title: Sources: Knicks expected to hire Mike Brown as head coach
content: The New York Knicks are expected to hire Mike Brown, a two-time winner of the NBA's Coach of the Year award, as the franchise's next head coach, sources told ESPN on Wednesday.

title: Woman accuses Bills' Hairston of sexual assault
content: An Ohio woman has sued Bills first-round draft pick Maxwell Hairston, accusing him of sexually assaulting her in 2021 when they both attended the University of Kentucky.

title: Cleveland, Detroit clap back at Cunningham barb
content: The cities of Cleveland and Detroit have pushed back at Sophie Cunningham after the Fever guard questioned the WNBA's plan to expand into those cities.

title: Red Panda injured during Fever-Lynx halftime
content: The popular halftime performer Red Panda was injured at the start of her act at the WNBA Commissioner's Cup championship game at Target Center on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Pistons add Robinson in sign-and-trade
content: Free agent sharpshooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Alcaraz cruises at Wimbledon as win streak hits 20
content: After being pushed to five sets in his opening match, two-time defending Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz enjoyed a more routine 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 win over British qualifier Oliver Tarvet on Wednesday.

title: Penn to ban trans athletes, ending Thomas case
content: The University of Pennsylvania has agreed to ban transgender women from its women's sports teams to resolve a federal civil rights case.

title: 'Resilient' Fever, missing Clark, win in-season title
content: Despite being without star Caitlin Clark and playing the league's first-place team on its home court, the 10.5-point underdog Fever defeated the Lynx 74-59 to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup.

title: NHL players get OK to participate in '26 Olympics
content: NHL players will be allowed to participate in the 2026 Milan-Cortina Olympics after league and international officials finalized an agreement Wednesday.

title: Introducing the 'Bag' Hall of Fame: Eight NFL stars who got PAID, over and over and over again
content: Which players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Ranking the best available NBA free agents after the initial rush
content: Which stars are available? Which teams need them? Kevin Pelton reveals his updated top 10, now including a former MVP.

title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee. What do the moves mean for the Bucks, Pacers and the NBA?

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players like Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup, and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: How the Fever rallied past the Lynx to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup
content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: PGA Tour Power Rankings: Scottie Scheffler and then who comes next?
content: No. 1 is obvious, but who comes after Scheffler in our ranking of the 25 best players on the PGA Tour ahead of the final major of the season?

title: Added touch: Opportunity knocks for these players in 2025
content: Who will benefit most from teams' vacated touches from last season? Eric Moody discusses the players poised to seize the opportunity.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: The Club World Cup means little for teams' 2025-26 prospects
content: Some of the world's biggest clubs have been knocked out of the Club World Cup, but that's no reason for their fans to panic about 2025-26.

title: Mbappe's CWC debut was badly needed for Real Madrid, FIFA and the player himself
content: Kylian Mbappe's return for Real Madrid was needed: for him, for his team, and for the Club World Cup itself.

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship starts on July 2. Here is a team-by-team guide on the 16 contenders.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: After Ilia Topuria's title-winning KO, who's No. 1 now?
content: Does the new lightweight champion leapfrog Islam Makhachev, who vacated the title, in ESPN's latest rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus make move for Sancho
content: Manchester United want £25m from the transfer of Jadon Sancho amid interest in the winger from Juventus. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Colwill warns signings: Chelsea 'for winners only'
content: Levi Colwill has warned Chelsea's new signings that the club is "for winners only" as the Blues prepare to face Palmeiras in Friday's Club World Cup quarter-finals.

title: Courtois: Alexander-Arnold a 'nightmare' for GKs
content: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois is very impressed by Trent Alexander-Arnold's "unbelievable" crossing ability, saying his new teammate is a "nightmare" for goalkeepers.

title: Sources: Valencia offer Arsenal target new deal
content: Valencia has offered Cristhian Mosquera a new contract in an attempt to prevent him from leaving for Arsenal, sources have told ESPN.

title: Monterrey's Torrent slams ref, VAR after CWC exit
content: Monterrey coach Domenec Torrent criticized the referee and the VAR's decisions in Tuesday night's 2-1 Club World Cup loss to Borussia Dortmund.

title: Sources: Canada's David to sign for Juventus
content: Juventus have agreed a deal to sign Canada international Jonathan David on a free from Lille, sources have told ESPN.

title: Jobe Bellingham to miss Jude, Real Madrid clash
content: Brothers Jude and Jobe Bellingham will miss the chance to face each other at the Club World Cup after Jobe picked up a yellow card in Borussia Dortmund's win over Monterrey on Tuesday.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Round 12 of the 2025 Formula 1 season is at Silverstone, as it hosts the British Grand Prix and celebrates 75 years of the pinnacle of motorsport.

title: Barcelona unveil 2025-26 home kit for return to Camp Nou
content: Lamine Yamal and Barcelona will be wearing the club's classic stripes but with a modern twist when they go home to Camp Nou after two years at Montjuïc.

title: 'Votebandi': INDIA Bloc vs Poll Body On Electoral Roll Revision In Bihar
content: Putting up a united front, a delegation of 11 parties from the INDIA bloc met the Election Commission on Wednesday to share their concerns over the revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, but came out more unhappy than they were when they went in.

title: Had To Put "Brave Face, Stoicism" During Cancer Treatment: Princess Kate
content: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, said that she had to put on a "brave face" throughout and following her cancer treatment last year, describing the ordeal as a life-changing experience.

title: Why Is Mars Barren, Uninhabitable? NASA's Curiosity Rover Offers New Clue
content: Mars is thought to currently have all the necessary ingredients for life except for perhaps the most important one: liquid water

title: 78 Vehicles Caught On Camera On Day 2 Of Delhi's Old-Vehicle Fuel Ban Rule
content: Delhi's crackdown on end-of-life vehicles continued on the second day with 78 overage vehicles flagged through the Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras across the city.

title: Parliament's Monsoon Session To Be Held From July 21 To August 21: Kiren Rijiju
content: The Monsoon session of Parliament will begin on July 21 and continue till August 21, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said on Wednesday.

title: My Journalistic "Experiment" With Bal Thackeray Never Took Off: Sharad Pawar
content: NCP (SP) president Sharad Pawar on Wednesday recalled his "experiment" with journalism, sharing that he and Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray had once tried to launch a monthly magazine, but the venture did not succeed.

title: Explained: After Sex Trafficking Trial, What's Next For Sean 'Diddy' Combs
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was found guilty on Wednesday of prostitution-related offenses but cleared of more serious charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking.

title: Rekha Gupta Unveils Restored Mughal-Era 'Sheeshmahal', Takes Swipe At AAP
content: The 'Sheeshmahal' - a name given to former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's official residence is back in the limelight after incumbent Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, from the BJP, took a swipe at the Aam Aadmi Party at an event.

title: As PM Modi Arrives In Ghana, Locals Chant 'Hare Rama Hare Krishna'
content: Over 15,000 Indians live in the West African country, with some being in Ghana for over 70 years. Some families are now the fourth generation in Ghana with some also acquiring Ghanaian citizenship.

title: Encounter Breaks Out Between Terrorists, Security Forces In J&K's Kishtwar
content: An encounter is underway between the Army and terrorists in the Chatroo area of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, officials said.

title: Live Updates: PM Modi Begins 5-Nation Tour, Arrives In Ghana To Strengthen Ties
content: LIve Updates: The Prime Minister will visit Argentina, Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, and Trinidad and Tobago. Ghana will be the first stop in the Prime Minister's visit, where he will meet President John Dramani Mahama

title: Food Delivery Agent Drowns In Swimming Pool On 22nd Floor Of Mumbai Building: Cops
content: A 44-year-old agent of an online food delivery app died after falling into the swimming pool on the 22nd floor of a residential building in South Mumbai, police said on Wednesday.

title: 9-Year-Old's Rapist Convicted: 1st Conviction In Bengal Post-Poll Violence
content: A man has been convicted for the rape of a nine-year-old in 2021, marking the first conviction in the post-poll violence cases investigated by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in West Bengal.

title: Over 100 Villages Badly Hit As Flood Situation Worsens In Odisha
content: The flood situation in Odisha has worsened with two districts, Gajapati and Balasore, being the worst affected by heavy rain over the last few days.

title: Watch: Massive Python Swallows Fox Alive In Jharkhand
content: A massive python swallowed a fox near Balediha village in Jharkhand's Giridih district. The incident occurred on Wednesday in a forest under the jurisdiction of the Sariya police station.

title: Trump Vows To 'Make NYC Great Again', Calls Mamdani "Communist Lunatic"
content: US President Donald Trump said that he will save the New York City from "Communist lunatic" Indian-origin mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani. In a post on Truth Social he wrote that he will not let the "Communist Lunatic" destroy New York.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Acquitted Of Sex-Trafficking, Found Guilty Of Prostitution
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was convicted of a US federal prostitution felony on Wednesday but acquitted on far more serious charges of racketeering and sex trafficking.

title: Bangladeshi Smugglers Attack BSF Team In Bengal, 1 Killed As Force Opens Fire
content: A group of smugglers from Bangladesh attacked Border Security Force personnel who were trying to stop them, resulting in the death of a smuggler in West Bengal's Nadia district on Wednesday.

title: Australia Cancels US Rapper Kanye West's Visa Over 'Heil Hitler' Song
content: Australia has cancelled US rapper Kanye West's visa over his song glorifying Nazi leader Adolf Hitler, the government said Wednesday.

title: France Registers Second-Warmest June Since Records Began In 1900
content: France registered its second-warmest June since records began in 1900, said the country's ministry for ecological transition on Wednesday, as Europe swelters under an early summer heatwave.

title: LaLiga 2025-26 fixtures: Clásico dates, more unmissable games
content: LaLiga's 2025-26 fixtures have been released. With managers, players and supporters able to plot their path to glory, here are the talking points.

title: SFI, DYFI protest against suspension of Kerala University Registrar
content: They warn of larger protests to counter the threats posed by those who have aligned with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh. Vice-Chancellor has no legal authority to suspend Registrar

title: COVID-19 vaccination has no link to sudden deaths in young adults: ICMR-NIE
content: Research had, in fact, indicated the positive effect of vaccination, the Director of the India Council of Medical Research-National Institute of Epidemiology said

title: Kolkata Police transfer law college gang rape case from SIT to Detective Department
content: The Kolkata Police have added new sections to the case, including those of kidnapping, causing grievous hurt with a dangerous weapon, and criminal intimidation

title: Samik Bhattacharya is the new West Bengal BJP president
content: The 62-year-old BJP leader is a party loyalist and has been associated with the party for over four decades. The elevation of Mr. Bhattacharya comes ahead of the Assembly polls in West Bengal scheduled in 2026

title: New mechanism to implement job-linked incentive scheme will be perfect: Centre
content: Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya says the scheme will function based on payroll addition in Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation and all employers enrolled under the EPFO will be eligible for the scheme

title: Karnataka Bank says customers have no reason to worry about  deposits
content: We are not in any kind of financial difficulty and we are constantly growing since our beginning, which is unique in the financial sector, says Chairman, Pradeep Kumar Panja

title: New flight service between Kurnool and Vijayawada commences
content: The new service will run three days a week and steps are being taken to run it on a daily basis, says Civil Aviation Minister

title: To fill ‘obvious gap’ ahead of Bihar polls, Chirag and party attempt Bahujan makeover
content: The LJP (RV) is making deliberate attempts to refashion itself from being a Dalit outfit to a Bahujan party. Its MP Arun Bharti said there is “an obvious gap in Bahujan leadership in the Hindi belt”.

title: 11 river sites breached warning levels, says goverment water body
content: Twelve sites in Assam, Bihar, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, and Uttar Pradesh flagged for “above-normal” flood situations, where water levels have crossed the warning threshold but remain below danger levels

title: Centre gives green signal for bike taxis; Rapido hails move
content: New guidelines allow aggregators to charge up to twice the base fare during peak hours as compared to maximum of 1.5 times allowed earlier

title: Exports from Kerala’s IT sector set to touch ₹1 lakh crore: CM
content: Pinarayi inaugurates new R&D centre set up by Software as a Service provider Zoho Corporation at Neduvathoor in Kottarakara

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Grief in two acts for Kutch family
content: Gujarat family mourns the loss of their son in an Air India crash, who was cremated twice and held final rites after DNA confirmation

title: Rahul Gandhi targets Modi government over shortage of specialised fertilizers from China
content: ‘India imports 80 per cent speciality fertilizers from China, but now they have suddenly stopped supply,’ the Congress leader said, sharing a news report

title: Expert Group on caste survey to submit its report to State government in 10 days
content: Forty-two parameters were used to analyse the caste census report, which collected data from over 3.55 crore residents of Telangana who responded to 74 questions

title: Bike taxis safer, more affordable: Bengaluru woman moves Karnataka HC over ban
content: The petitioner says background checks, police verification, bar on those with past and present criminal cases were among the stringent conditions imposed on riders for operating bike taxis in other States

title: Window frame of Spicejet aircraft dislodges mid-air, no impact on passenger safety: airline
content: SpiceJet reassures passengers after dislodged window frame incident mid-air, emphasising no compromise on safety

title: Rejuvenation of Saduperi irrigation tank near Vellore on fast track
content: At present, more than 15,000 residents in at least eight surrounding villages depend on the tank for water consumption

title: Employment-Linked Incentive Scheme a ploy to transfer public funds to corporates: CPI(M)
content: The party claims the ELI scheme promotes fragile and precarious jobs, subsidising investment cost, production costs, labour costs and statutory liabilities of both domestic and foreign employers from public exchequer

title: Will complete Yettinahole project and supply drinking water in two years to 75 lakh people across nine districts: CM
content: Chief Minister says that of the total 24.1 tmcft needed for the project, 14 tmcft will be used for drinking water purposes

title: Political dispensation expresses dissatisfaction over doctor’s post
content: B. Ekbal says while govt. focussed on building infrastructure and acquiring sophisticated diagnostic devices, similar attention is not given to modernisation of administrative processes

title: Major industrial mishap averted at Andhra Paper Mill campus
content: The leakage was reported from a tanker that arrived from Gujarat carrying 26.8 tonnes of hydrogen peroxide; it was successfully plugged and diluted remaining chemical was drained out of the tank.

title: Saseendran expresses concern over tribal deaths, calls for steps to adopt indigenous knowledge
content: He was inaugurating a State-level workshop on Gothrabheri, an initiative aimed at integrating indigenous knowledge into wildlife conflict mitigation strategies

title: Wife suspects foul play in Singaiah’s death during Jagan’s Rentapalla visit
content: Something suspicious might have happened in the ambulance, alleges Lourdu Mary, adding that she trusts the YSRCP president, and calls for a transparent and independent investigation into the accident

title: Security guard’s brawl embarrasses TTD
content: The unpleasant incident which took place on Sunday is believed to have been sparked by an alleged dispute over ‘hafta’

title: Telangana CID nabs another accused in inter-State kidney trafficking racket
content: For each transplant, the accused is believed to have earned a commission of ₹10 lakh, out of which only ₹4 to ₹5 lakh was paid to the donor

title: Receiving positive response from people on State’s governance, says A.P. Finance Minister
content: Distributes free pigeon pea seeds to 55 farmers in Jayapuram village in Uravakonda constituency as part of ‘Suparipalanalo Tholi Adugu’ programme

title: Kerala regains lost ground to emerge second in National Achievement Survey
content: State is ranked third in class III, first in class VI, and second in class IX. Minister for General Education V. Sivankutty says Kerala made the gains despite the Union government holding back funds due to the State under Centrally sponsored education schemes

title: CBI files three more chargesheets against parents of Walayar girls for abetting rape and sexual assault on their minor daughters
content: On Wednesday, the agency filed two chargesheets against the parents  at the CBI Special Court, Kochi, for abetting and facilitating Pradeep to repeatedly sexually assault their daughters. The CBI alleged in another chargesheet that the parents also facilitated sexual assault on the elder child by Kutti Madhu

title: Union Government comes up with an AI-based app that helps prevent potential financial risks online
content: When run on a pilot basis with SBI and PhonePe, the Financial Fraud Risk Indicator has successfully blocked two lakh high-risk transactions in two weeks with 99% predictability, says Union Minister Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar, adding that it will soon be deployed in all financial institutions

title: Bharat Mata row: Kerala University V-C suspends Registrar, sparks political row and legal showdown
content: The suspension, which has triggered both political backlash and the prospect of legal confrontation, relates to the event at Senate Hall here where a function was ‘disrupted’ over the display of the controversial Bharat Mata portrait

title: Kolkata college gang rape: WB women's panel head says 'traumatised' victim needs more counselling
content: West Bengal Commission for Women chairperson emphasises need for counselling and justice for gang-rape survivor in Kolkata college

title: Cases filed against 265 property tax evaders in Nellore
content: Appear for the National Lok Adalat to be held at Principal District and Sessions Court on July 5, says Nellore Municipal Corporation Commissioner

title: Drug cartel active across four continents busted in multi-agency operation
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praises NCB and other agencies for the success; eight alleged syndicate members have been arrested so far

title: Suchitwa Mission to step up activities to reduce plastic use
content: International Plastic Bag Free Day on July 3. Suchitwa Mission calls on people to participate in activities to make State plastic-free

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: NWSL's Boston signs Karich as first player
content: the midfielder is on loan at an undisclosed Liga MX Femenil club for the remainder of 2025 . the club said that she will go on loan to a london club before joining for preseason . thomas muller is the first player in the club's history .

title: João Pedro signs for Chelsea in £60m deal
content: the 23-year-old has signed an eight-year deal at a total of £60 million ($82m) with the club . sources have told ESPN that he prefers a move to the club amid interest from Newcastle . Pedro made the move to English football in 2020, spending three years at Watford .

title: Under-the-radar players who could emerge for every top 25 team
content: the post-spring top 25 is a look at players who could be considered sleepers . our reporters break down the potential sleepers they're keeping tabs on . cnick dawkins offensive linemen naturally get overlooked .

title: NHL free agency tracker: A flurry of signings on July 1
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Top 50 trade deadline candidates -- and their best landing spots
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: Which clubs are the best transfer fit for Europe's top strikers?
content: arsenal have had the 22-year-old on their radar for some time . but the drawn-out nature of negotiations over a potential €70 million move raises some questions . he offers both a target to play the ball in to and a threat in behind the defense .

title: From Bill Walsh to Bill Belichick: What happens when a legendary NFL coach moves on to college football?
content: a year into retirement from coaching, a former NBC exec says he would have stayed with the 49ers . he says if he wanted the job, it would have put the franchise on a course that didn't lead to Bill Belichick in 2000 . in doing so, he redirected football history .

title: Big upsets: Gauff headlines record-breaking number of top-10 players eliminated
content: pegula beaten 6-2, 6-3 in the first round at the all England club . the world no. 3 had just won the title, the ninth of her career and second on grass . she was hardly the only top-three women's player to lose in the wildly unpredictable opening round .

title: If Americans don't move in this transfer window, is the USMNT doomed?
content: Mauricio Pochettino is the manager of the usmNT . he's a theory, or maybe just a collective conclusion . the way to optimize the USMNT's performance would be to find the right players .

title: Midyear divisional grades: Kayla Harrison in an F-rated division?
content: the UFC has put on seven pay-per-view events and 15 Fight Night cards in eight U.S. states and seven international countries . we've seen six new champions crowned (one of whom didn't even have to fight for it), six title defenses and countless knockouts .

title: 📋 NHL free agency: Grades for all the big signings
content: the 2025 offseason has been a roller coaster with several key players being traded . 224 prospects finding new homes via the draft and a slew of re-signings . the player's fit with his new team, terms of the deal and more will be grading .

title: Premier League 2025-26 kit ranking: Every new jersey released so far
content: the top 20 teams will not renew hostilities until mid-August . several of the country's biggest clubs have already unveiled the jerseys . we've kicked off our annual analysis below and will add each new home .
